page.title: 02ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The area has 760_890mm of rainfall per year and little industrial pollution.It is wettest from mid_October to mid_November and driest in March and April. The area is very flat with little snow. North_westerly to South_westerly winds prevail, bringing rain.Evaporation is very high and the atmosphere is very humid. Average temperatures are 15.6 degrees Celcius for summer and 5.0 degrees Celcius for winter. The land lies below 61m and consists mainly of Shirdlyhill sands and Keuper sandstone.The land is poorly drained.Farmland is used mainly for dairy cattle.West of Bromborough there are coppices where wild life survives.Foxes and voles are common.The area is densely populated but not crowded.Houses are pleasant, there is little dereliction.
